image.altText: Former South Australian state Labor MP Annabel Digance.

props.synopsis: A South Australian court did not find former MP Annabel Digance and her husband guilty of blackmailing Premier Peter Malinauskas, despite a previous claim by the premier's lawyer in court, a leaked email obtained by ABC News reveals.

title.children: Ex-MP accused of blackmailing premier was not found guilty despite previous court claim

image.altText: A man wears a black hat and a black top, he looks solemnly at camera. Behind him is a sign reading 'Buy SA'

props.synopsis: Amid SA's algal bloom, fish and chip shop owners are keen to emphasise they are still very much open for business â€” and some want more done to provide reassurance.

title.children: Fish and chip shops battle to calm algae anxiety

image.altText: A woman leaning on white boxes filled with jujubes.

props.synopsis: Jujubes boast high nutritional values and thousands of years of versatile use in Asia, and farmers are determined to put them on consumers' plates.

title.children: Farmers bet on nutritionally rich jujubes becoming next food trend

image.altText: Electricians place solar panels on roof

props.synopsis: As Australia's energy transition hits turbulence, a quiet but fundamental shift is underway.

title.children: Can Australia's staggering 'small-scale flex' save our energy future?

image.altText: APY Lands general manager Richard King.

props.synopsis: The controversial reappointment of APY Lands general manager Richard King is under a South Australian government-commissioned review following claims of a flawed recruitment process.

title.children: Reappointment of APY Lands general manager under review

image.altText: A dead marine animal washed up along an Adelaide beach.

props.synopsis: Amid SA's devastating algal bloom, a citizen scientist says she has recorded more than 1,000 observations of dead sea creatures along a 500-metre stretch of a popular Adelaide beach in less than a fortnight.

title.children: Citizen scientist's grim report on algal bloom impact on 500m beach

image.altText: Two older women one wearing a black top and one wearing a pink top sitting at a table smiling with coffee cups in front of them.

props.synopsis:
Noni Wilson, 89, is commended for putting up a fight when a stranger tried to steal a car she was sitting in outside Broken Hill Hospital.Â 

Â

title.children: Unable to 'flight', 89yo goes into 'fight' mode to thwart carjacker

image.altText: A waterbomber fighting the Ledge Point blaze.

props.synopsis: Longer fire seasons pose a challenge for countries in different hemispheres that traditionally lend each other a hand during disasters.

title.children: Longer fire seasons could create 'tensions' over resources

image.altText: Charlotte Walker smiles as she sits wearing a black blazer

props.synopsis: Charlotte Walker says she has faced both misogyny and criticism in her short time as South Australian senator, but says it's all worth it to be a politician.

title.children: Australia's youngest senator says misogyny, ageist comments 'worth it'

image.altText: A young woman with brown hair and a yellow, black and red scarf sits in a chair in front of windows and smiles.

props.synopsis: When more than 90,000 people marched across the Sydney Harbour Bridge it created headlines across the globe. So how has the addition of more than 30 anti-protest laws across the past two decades affected demonstrating?

title.children: Have anti-protest laws changed the way young people demonstrate?

image.altText: regulator from side on with water in foreground and sky and trees in background

props.synopsis:
NSW Natural Resources Access Regulator issues a stop-work order halting environmental water flows in Toorale National Park, citing a lack of mandatory reporting.

Â 

Â

title.children: Environmental flows halted in national park over water reporting concerns

image.altText: A photo of Tsutomu Yamaguchi. He has short white hair, brown eyes, and is wearing a black collared shirt.

props.synopsis: There are not many people that have survived a nuclear attack. Tsutomu Yamaguchi is the only person that officially survived two.

title.children: 'It was my fate to keep on living': How one man survived two nuclear attacks

image.altText: James Tomkins drapped in the Australian flag, in front of the Olympic rings, looking over his right shoulder

props.synopsis: A Victorian study has found elite male rowers are seven times more likely to develop atrial fibrillation, a common heart rhythm disorder associated with increased risk of stroke.

title.children: Could 'too much' exercise lead to a heart disorder in elite athletes?

image.altText: A small bright green airplane in a hanger.

props.synopsis: It's been a week since Tasmanian couple Gregory Vaughan and Kim Worner along with their dog Molly, stepped into a small green plane and flew away without a trace.

title.children: Disappearance of couple and dog begs question of how a plane can go missing in 2025

image.altText: A four-wheel drive with police decals and lights outside a house

props.synopsis: Domestic violence support advocates say reaching isolated towns to help victim-survivors can be a challenge, following a murder-suicide at Bordertown.

title.children: 'Devastating' murder-suicide prompts calls for more help in isolated areas

image.altText: Two glasses of brandy are held together, toasted, man with chin, slight moustache, blue jumper.

props.synopsis: In the past, much of the grape production in South Australia's Coonawarra region was used for making brandy. Now, a local winery is producing it again.Â

title.children: Hopes for a brandy comeback as Coonawarra produces first branded batch

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds a press conference with New Zealand prime minister Christopher Luxon.

props.synopsis: The two leaders are also expected to discuss their positions on the humanitarian crisis in Gaza and recognising Palestinian statehood.

title.children: Defence and trade top of the agenda for PM's meeting in New Zealand

image.altText: Graphic of Queensland premier David Crisafulli with business receipts.

props.synopsis: Politicians have private business, but that business is sometimes thrust into the public arena, raising questions about how transparent they're required to be, writes Liam Walsh.

title.children: How Qld's premier went from property flipper to secret business trouble

image.altText: Tall pine trees in front of a snow-capped mountain range.

props.synopsis: National Parks are being forced to stay open despite operating on a "bare-bones" crew after cuts to staff and funding. Rangers say they can't sustain it.Â

image.altText: Inside the La Trobe Reading Room at the State Library Victoria.

props.synopsis: Are we really comfortable with trading away one of the few financial benefits Australian creatives have left?

title.children: We can't throw Australian creatives and their work into the maws of Big Tech

image.altText: Kathleen Folbigg thanks her supporters in a video she released after being pardoned for wrongful conviction

props.synopsis: Experts are calling for more transparency in the way compensation is calculated for people who are wrongfully imprisoned, after a $2 million payment offered to Kathleen Folbigg was slammed as "totally inadequate".

title.children: 'Can you put a number on it?' The price of wrongful imprisonment

image.altText: A person with short, red hair and striped blue and red long sleeved top sits under blue moody lights looking down at camera

props.synopsis: For generations of musicians, there was a simple recipe for success: pack your bags and move to the west but those markets are being challenged by the growing prestige and influence of the music business in Asia.Â

title.children: How Asia is changing the classic Aussie band origin story

image.altText: noni Hazlehurst, with fair long hair and fringe, sits near a front bar at a pub, smiling with closed mouth.

image.altText: Matt Wright pic (1)

props.synopsis: Bugged phone calls, allegations of lies and planned destruction of evidence â€” revelations from the first week of the criminal trial against Outback Wrangler Matt Wright.

title.children: Outback Wrangler's bugged midnight phone call at centre of charge

image.altText: close up of man wearing a space suit with his head revealed, he is smiling

props.synopsis: In a statement, his family hails him as their "hero" and say the man who led the infamous Apollo 13 space mission "was truly one of a kind".

title.children: Apollo 13 moon mission commander Jim Lovell dies at 97

image.altText: A hand holds a black sandal with a woven upper.

props.synopsis: Adidas could face legal action as Mexican authorities accuse the brand of copying traditional huarache sandals.

title.children: Mexico seeks legal action after Adidas launches sandals with traditional style

image.altText: Stefano Vukov and Elena Rybakina during a practice session ahead of the 2024 Australian Open.

image.altText: smoke billows out from rubble after the 9/11 attacks

title.children: More September 11 victims' remains identified 24 years later

image.altText: President Donald Trump speaks to US military officers

props.synopsis: The US president has directed the Pentagon to prepare options, however Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said in response that members of the US military would not be entering Mexican territory.

title.children: Trump moves to target drug cartels with US military

image.altText: A young woman with long black hair holds a baby girl in her arms standing in a kitchen

props.synopsis: Women who have spent years navigating the health system seeking care for extreme pain say they are frustrated at the slow pace of a government inquiry into the issue.

title.children: 'It's not right': Frustration as Australian-first women's pain inquiry in limbo

image.altText: Head and shoulders portrait of Gareth Ward

props.synopsis: Well before Gareth Ward's conviction for serious sex crimes, he was one of the most powerful politicians in NSW. His political career unravelled until he stood alone and, finally, in the dock.

title.children: Matildas relishing 'perfect test' ahead of Asian Cup campaign

image.altText: Chris Woakes leaves the field injured during England's fifth Test against India.
